actions.text: Referred to the Committee on HELP.
Senate Committee on HELP discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

committees.committee: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing congressional support for the International Labor Organization's Declaration on Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the International Labor Organization's Declaration on Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work is an important achievement that may help advance core labor standards in a competitive global economy; and (2) the President should use all means at the President's disposal to ensure that the Declaration and its Follow Up Mechanism evolve into an effective means of monitoring worldwide compliance with core labor standards.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing congressional support for the International Labor Organization's Declaration on Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work.
